title: Photos: Picture-perfect Meals for October
text: Activate your digital access. Photos: Picture-perfect Meals for October Mary Josselson of Cocoa Beach tried the Alpaca at Inkawasi Restaurant near Machu Picchu, Peru. “It tasted like a cross between steak and pork.” Provided Joan Berrios of Suntree says the Provençal Jambon & Fromage — smoked ham, Gruyere, tarragon Dijon and arugla, served with a mixed green salad — is “the most yummy.” She enjoyed the meal at The Parkview on Park Avenue in Winter Park. Provided “Delish,” said Joyce Scafidi of Merritt Island when describing the Roast Duck on a bed of mashed potatoes. She had the meal during a girls’ night out at Crush Eleven in Cocoa Village. Provided Pelly and Marge Clericuzio of Cape Canaveral enjoyed a German-style mixed salad at Edelweiss Authentic Austrian and German Restaurant. Provided This Diablo Stew, described as “a great spicy soup” included large shrimp and avocado added right before serving, according to Sue van Vonno. She and her daughter Cyndi Henry dined at Coda Urban Bistro in Richmond, Virginia. Provided Fullscreen John Williams of Melbourne tried the Cherry Chipotle Glazed Salmon at the newly opened BJ’s Restaurant and Brewhouse at Melbourne Square mall. The meail included oven-roasted Atlantic salmon topped with a slightly sweet and savory cherry chipotle glaze, served with roasted asparagus and a fire-roasted red bell pepper, tomato and spinach couscous. Provided This Diablo Stew, described as “a great spicy soup” included large shrimp and avacodo added right before serving, according to Sue van Vonno. She and her daughter Cyndi Henry dined at Coda Urban Bistro in Richmond, Virginia. Provided Fullscreen Bonnie Slovak of Melbourne Beach had a Shrimp Scampi on Flatbread at Jake’s Crab Shack in Melbourne Beach. “A friend recommended this, and even though it was not on their menu, they made it, and I am so glad they did,” she said. Provided Fullscreen Mike and Carla Donovan of Melbourne, along with Sheila Cootes of Merritt Island, enjoyed brunch at Crush Eleven in Cocoa Village, and in particular the Lake Meadow Farms Duck Egg Quiche with butternut squash, kale, Black Forrest ham and feta cheese. “Delicious!” Provided Mary Ann and Leo Carter of Cocoa Beach think the Fiery Dragon sushi at the Pacific Rim Restaurant on Merritt Island is one of the best. Provided Roberta LeMoine captured a photo of Florida Citrus Swordfish at Cobbs Landing in Fort Pierce while on a weekend boat trip. Provided This delicious flourless chocolate cake with pomegranate finished off a fabulous meal at cuiZine in Satellite Beach, enjoyed by Jeanne Rossi of Indian Harbour Beach.
